casebody.data:
Robert G. McCRAY, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. A. F. LEE, Commissioner of State Board of Corrections, et al., Defendants-Appellees. No. 72-2460. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. July 28, 1972. Robert G. McCray, pro se. Arthur K. Bolton, Atty. Gen., Atlanta, Ga., for defendants-appellees.

Before JOHN R. BROWN, Chief Judge, and GOLDBERG and MORGAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

We vacate the District Court’s order summarily dismissing the complaint and remand for further proceedings consistent with our opinion in Williams v. Wainwright, 5 Cir., 1972, 461 F.2d 1080 and companion cases.1

Vacated and remanded.

. It is appropriate to dispose of this case summarily. See Groendyke Transportation, Inc. v. Davis, 5 Cir., 1969, 406 F.2d 1158.
